intro: Galvezia ballii, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped, and its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Galvezia ballii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
